text:
While you can't technically
use an actual video
as wallpaper on your iPhone,
you can use an animated live photo,
which will look very similar.

You can also convert
videos into live photos
using the third-party app IntoLive.

To set a live photo as
your iPhone wallpaper,

open your settings and
scroll down to "Wallpaper."
Tap "Choose a New Wallpaper,"
select "Live Photos,"
and choose the live photo you'd like
as your background.

Tap "Set," then choose
either "Set Lock Screen,"
"Set Home Screen," or "Set Both."
To view your live wallpaper,

touch and hold a finger to
your screen for about a second,
and it will begin to animate.

Download the IntoLive
app from the App Store.
The basic version is free.

Open the app and allow
access to your photo library.

Select the video tab and
the file you want to use.

Select the effects you'd
like to add to your video

and adjust the clip
length using the sliders.

Your live photo can be
as long as five seconds.

Tap "Make" and wait as
the live photo is created.
You'll have to bypass ads to finish.
Once done, go to your settings
and set the new live photo
that you just created.
